meanings.definition: The rear lights on a vehicle that light up when the brakes are applied.
meanings.sent1: The taillamps of the car glowed brightly when it stopped.
meanings.sent2: Make sure your taillamps are working properly for safe driving at night.
meanings.sent3: The taillamps decided to throw a party every time the brakes were pressed.
meanings.sent4: Her taillamps shone like beacons in the darkness, guiding the way.
meanings.sent5: The taillamps illuminated the road behind, like tiny red stars in the night sky.

meanings.definition: The red lights on the back of a car that indicate its presence and direction to other drivers.
meanings.sent1: I could see the taillamps of the car ahead signaling a left turn.
meanings.sent2: In foggy weather, it's crucial to have bright taillamps for visibility.
meanings.sent3: The taillamps were feeling extra flashy today, showing off their red glow.
meanings.sent4: His taillamps were like a lighthouse in the sea of traffic, guiding others safely.
meanings.sent5: The taillamps stood out in the dark, a clear warning to those behind.
